title: union together with azureblob causes SIGSEGV panic
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

I tried merging two azure SAS endpoints via union storage system. When I click on a subpath in the http serving, the process fails and causes SIGSEGV panic.  

If I use the individual azureblob storage system for running serve, it works fine. 

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.53.3
- os/arch: darwin/amd64
- go version: go1.15.5
```

#### Config ~/.config/rclone/rclone.conf

```
[azuresas1]
type = azureblob
sas_url = https://xxxxx.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/?SAS

[azuresas2]
type = azureblob
sas_url = https://xxxxx2.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/?SAS

[merged]
type = union
upstreams = azuresas1::ro azuresas2::ro
action_policy = epall
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

MacOSX 10.15.7

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

Azureblob

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

rclone serve http merged:
